feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 18 at 9:02AM AKDT until March 18 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blowing snow with low visibility and cold wind chills occuring. Plan on areas of poor visibilities to create difficult travel conditions at times. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow.

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 18 at 8:56AM AKDT until March 19 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 55 below occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Central Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...Now to noon Saturday.

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 18 at 8:56AM AKDT until March 19 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 50 below occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...Now to noon Saturday.

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 18 at 8:56AM AKDT until March 19 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 50 below occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...In passes of the Northeastern Brooks Range. * WHEN....Now through 1 PM Saturday

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 18 at 5:26AM AKDT until March 18 at 5:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blowing snow occurring. Visibilities reduced to one half mile or less at times. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts as high as 50 mph.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 18 at 5:26AM AKDT until March 19 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 AM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Visibilities reduced to one half mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Northerly winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts as high as 50 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 12:55PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mobile and west central Baldwin Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 1255 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Tanner Williams, or 13 miles west of Midtown Mobile, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 5:02AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...MODEST SYSTEM WITH LIGHT SNOW AND BREEZES THIS WEEKEND... A fast moving storm system will move across the region Saturday into early Sunday, bringing breezy winds with chances for rain and snow showers Saturday into Saturday evening, followed by chilly conditions with brisk northwest to north winds Sunday. * SNOW: Projected snowfall amounts are up to 3 inches above 5000
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.summary: ...Threat of rapid wildfire growth and spread... .The combination of gusty breezy north winds, very low relative humidity values, and dry grasses and brush, will allow for any wildfire activity to grow and spread rapidly through this afternoon.
